auto_merge.commit_title: feat: make :restart work for remote UI (#34354)

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

comment_data.body: If the server was originally started with `--headless` but the client can only start an `--embed` UI, `--headless` needs to be removed from `argv` for the restart to work, and vice versa. I'm not entirely sure if it should be the client or the server that removes `--embed` or `--headless` from `argv`, but considering the possible future addition of `:restart [args]`, I'm inclined to do this on the server, since custom  `[args]` usually doesn't include `--embed` or `--headless` either.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -249,6 +248,14 @@ the editor.
 	Indicates to the UI that it must stop rendering the cursor. This event
 	is misnamed and does not actually have anything to do with busyness.
 
+["restart", progpath, argv] ~
+	|:restart| command has been used and the Nvim server is about to exit.
+	The UI should start a new Nvim server using `progpath` as the full path
+	to the Nvim executable |v:progpath| and `argv` as its command-line
+	arguments |v:argv|, and then reattach to the new server.
+	Note: |--embed| and |--headless| are excluded from `argv`, and the client

comment_data.body: Strongly prefer doing as much as possible on the server, in general.

comment_data.body:
nit: helps discovery, not much churn?

```suggestion
static void ex_quitall_or_restart(exarg_T *eap)
```

Took me a second to understand this
```suggestion
    -- :restart avoids a --listen conflict when server exit is delayed.
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -223,6 +237,21 @@ describe('TUI :restart', function()
     -- Check ":restart!".
     tt.feed_data(':restart!\013')
     screen:expect(s0)
+    restart_pid_check()
+
+    tt.feed_data(':echo\n')
+    screen:expect([[
+      ^                                                  |
+      {4:~                                                 }|*3
+      {5:[No Name]                                         }|
+                                                        |
+      {3:-- TERMINAL --}                                    |
+    ]])
+
+    -- :restart also works without --listen conflict when server exit is delayed.

comment_data.body: The `@param args` part may be misleading, as they are arguments of the UI event,

should we ELOG a message on failure ? I don't remember if the UI client can log things though, but maybe it can emit something to the server (though that might not even exist), or maybe to stderr?

not a blocker
I've renamed `ui_client_do_restart()` to `ui_client_may_restart_server()` and moved the pending check into that function.

comment_regular_data.body: I have to include most of #34261 in this PR.
Thinking about this again, the client should still wait for the server to exit before starting a new server, as the two servers may conflict with each other (e.g. listening on the same socket).

> I have to include most of #34261 in this PR.

should i just merge that pr now ?
Probably, my further doc changes are based on the changes in #34261.

title: feat: make :restart work for remote UI
